title: Top Tory accused of offering 'VIP lane' for Rishi Sunak's wife's firm in UK

title: Rishi Sunak's warned disposable ban could lead to 'turf wars' by doctors as Australia's anti-vaping laws leads to rise in smoking and gang violence
description: The package of proposals, unveiled by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak last week, came after reports the number of children vaping has tripled in three years.

title: CITY WHISPERS: Electricity firm Bboxx in shock relocation - to Rwanda
description: Bboxx has announced that it will be upping sticks and shifting its global headquarters from London to the capital Kigali.

title: Villagers slam plans for shipping container development next to homes
description: Villagers have hit out at plans to install nearly 900 shipping containers next to their homes as part of a new battery storage energy system.

title: Labour vetoes ex-Barclays chief for net zero job after diversity row
description: Party claims shortlist of six to be climate watchdog boss ‘lacks credibility’, meaning process could be re-run after general election

title: Pro-Palestine demonstrators promise to march for 'as long as it takes'
description: In contrast with the constant flux of the situation in the Middle East - the US airstrikes on Iranian-linked targets the latest example - protesters' demands have remained the same, ever since the first of these marches in October. Ending the war in Gaza, in their view, ends the wider regional conflict.

title: Police release footage of raid on home in hunt for corrosive substance attack suspect
description: “Significant and important pieces of evidence” were recovered in raids at two addresses in east London and three in Newcastle, police said. They include empty containers with corrosive warnings found at one address in Newcastle, which the new footage shows.

title: UK Orders Crack Down On 'Dirty Money' And 'Counterfeit Goods' Coming From London's American-Style Candy Shops
description: Police have seized more than 2,000 unlawful items from an American sweet shop in London, including fake designer products and vapes containing illegal amounts of nicotine.

title: Labour ditches radical reforms as it prepares ‘bombproof’ election manifesto
description: Plans to reform social care and House of Lords are trimmed as Keir Starmer’s party opts for caution ahead of vote

title: A crash course in British politics: How elections work (Week 1)
description: This week’s article will explain how British elections work, and hopefully will answer all your related questions.

title: More than 100 MPs and peers join call to ban Iranian ‘terrorist’ group
description: More than 100 parliamentarians have urged Rishi Sunak to stand up to the Iranian regime’s “belligerence” by proscribing its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) as terrorists, as Conservative MPs warned the Prime Minister: “We need a new strategy.”

title: Police release footage of raid on address in Abdul Ezedi manhunt
description: Police searching for alkali attack suspect Abdul Ezedi have released footage of empty containers with corrosive warnings being found by officers.

title: Thousands gather in Edinburgh to call for immediate ceasefire in Gaza
description: Thousands of pro-Palestine supporters gathered in Edinburgh on Saturday in support of an immediate ceasefire in Gaza. Carrying Palestinian flags and placards, they marched from Edinburgh Castle down the Royal Mile to the Scottish Parliament, shouting slogans such as: “No Justice, No Peace”, and: “Ceasefire now!”

title: Armagh legend’s personal thank you letter from ‘fellow dog lover’ PM Rishi Sunak
description: It comes a month after Willie was officially honoured with Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s daily Point of Light award for his contributions to charity. Willie has been fundraising for 50 years and has raised over £1 million for charity in that time.

title: Labour Backtrack On £28 Billion Green Investment Pledge After Weeks Of Confusion
description: With a UK general election looming, the Labour Party are starting to persuade business and financial sector leaders that it can be trusted to grow the economy.
